title: Súni Olsen
text:
Súni Olsen (born 7 March 1981) is a <a href="Faroe%20Islands">Faroese</a> former professional <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="midfielder%20%28football%29">midfielder</a>.
Club career.
He started his career at Faroese club <a href="G%C3%8D%20G%C3%B8ta">GÍ Gøta</a>, after a successful season in 2000, in which he scored 13 league goals, moved to Dutch side <a href="FC%20Zwolle">FC Zwolle</a> in 2001, becoming the second Faroese international to play in the <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a> after <a href="Jan%20Allan%20M%C3%BCller">Jan Allan Müller</a> played for <a href="Go%20Ahead%20Eagles">Go Ahead Eagles</a> in 1990/1991. He returned to GÍ in 2002, and after a prolific number of goals for a midfielder, he attracted the attention of Danish team <a href="AaB%20Fodbold">AaB</a>, where he was later joined by Faroese teammate <a href="J%C3%B3n%20R%C3%B3i%20Jacobsen">Jón Rói Jacobsen</a>. In 2008, he was allowed to leave to <a href="Viborg%20FF">Viborg</a> on a free transfer, after failing to break into the first team squad at Aalborg. After a disappointing season at Viborg FF, he left Denmark and went back to the <a href="Faroe%20Islands">Faroe Islands</a> at <a href="B36%20T%C3%B3rshavn">B36 Tórshavn</a>. He played 2 games before he broke his foot and then did not play another match for B36. In October 2008, he agreed to leave B36 for <a href="J%C3%B3gvan%20Martin%20Olsen">Jógvan Martin Olsen</a>'s new side, Víkingur. In November 2015, Olsen signed for KÍ Klaksvík.
International career.
Olsen made his debut for the <a href="Faroe%20Islands%20national%20football%20team">Faroe Islands national football team</a> in January 2001, in a <a href="2000%E2%80%9301%20Nordic%20Football%20Championship">Nordic Championship</a> match against <a href="Sweden%20national%20football%20team">Sweden</a>, coming on as a substitute for Sámal Joensen. He played magnificently against Estonia in a friendly in Summer 2008, scoring one goal and making two assists, bringing the Faroe Islands level, after being 3-0 down at half time. On 15 October 2013, Suni Olsen retired from International football following an <a href="2014%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">2014 FIFA World Cup qualification</a> match against Austria.
